author: Christina Erne
title: chevron-right
text: From: Christina Erne, Storm Team 10 Meteorologist: We continue to be stuck in an unsettled weather pattern with cooler than usual temperatures taking us through the weekend. Today, highs reach the upper 50s with a few light spotty showers through at least mid-morning, clearing by afternoon, but leaving us mainly cloudy. Below normal temperatures and mainly cloudy skies remain in place all weekend long with a low risk of a shower each day. Breaks of sun here or there are possible Saturday, and after a few showers pass the Cape by mid-morning, drier skies can take over. A few isolated showers are possible for Mother's Day, although more dry skies are expected than wet. Storm Team 10 Weather Blog: Read the latest weather news and headlines for Southern New England Friday: A few spotty showers early, mainly cloudy into the afternoon. High: 58 Saturday: Partly to mostly cloudy. High: 59 Mother's Day: Mostly cloudy, slight chance of a few spotty showers. High: 58 Monday: Partly cloudy. High: 66 Tuesday: Sun & clouds increase, rain possible by evening. High: 71 Wednesday: Showers possible, especially early. High: 65 Thursday: Turning partly cloudy.
